\subsection{Detailed Description}
Utility functions for memory manipulation.

\subsection{Function Documentation}
\hypertarget{memutils_8h_a9cebf4b6732b1c2d98613e00e0c788b8}{\index{memutils.\-h@{memutils.\-h}!memcpy32@{memcpy32}}
\index{memcpy32@{memcpy32}!memutils.h@{memutils.\-h}}
\subsubsection[{memcpy32}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}void$\ast$ memcpy32 (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{void $\ast$}]{dst, }
\item[{const void $\ast$}]{src, }
\item[{uint32\-\_\-t}]{size}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}\label{memutils_8h_a9cebf4b6732b1c2d98613e00e0c788b8}


Copy memory from source in memory to destination. 

{\bfseries Description\-:} Copies {\ttfamily size} bytes from {\ttfamily src} memory area to {\ttfamily dst} memory area. N\-O\-T\-E\-: Addresses and size must be 32-\/bit aligned.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em dst} & Pointer to destination memory area \\
\hline
{\em src} & Pointer to source memory area \\
\hline
{\em size} & Size of data in bytes\\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
Void pointer to the destination memory 
\end{DoxyReturn}
\hypertarget{memutils_8h_ac242fda1f425f7087869284c4437f35b}{\index{memutils.\-h@{memutils.\-h}!memset32@{memset32}}
\index{memset32@{memset32}!memutils.h@{memutils.\-h}}
\subsubsection[{memset32}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}void$\ast$ memset32 (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{void $\ast$}]{ptr, }
\item[{int}]{value, }
\item[{size\-\_\-t}]{size}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}\label{memutils_8h_ac242fda1f425f7087869284c4437f35b}


Fills a block of memory with a constant value. 

{\bfseries Description\-:} Sets {\ttfamily size} bytes of memory starting at {\ttfamily ptr} with value {\ttfamily value} N\-O\-T\-E\-: Address and size must be 32-\/bit aligned.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em ptr} & Pointer to memory \\
\hline
{\em value} & Value to set \\
\hline
{\em size} & Size of memory in bytes\\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
Void pointer to the memory 
\end{DoxyReturn}
\hypertarget{memutils_8h_a23231c7cb92cb998ad2f1abc346d4af0}{\index{memutils.\-h@{memutils.\-h}!Reverse\-Bytes32@{Reverse\-Bytes32}}
\index{Reverse\-Bytes32@{Reverse\-Bytes32}!memutils.h@{memutils.\-h}}
\subsubsection[{Reverse\-Bytes32}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}void Reverse\-Bytes32 (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{void $\ast$}]{ptr, }
\item[{uint32\-\_\-t}]{size}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}\label{memutils_8h_a23231c7cb92cb998ad2f1abc346d4af0}


Reverses bytes in memory. 

{\bfseries Description\-:} Reverses in-\/place the {\ttfamily size} bytes in {\ttfamily ptr} memory area, so that the last byte in the buffer becomes the first byte. This is typically used to deal with endianness. N\-O\-T\-E\-: Address and size must be 32-\/bit aligned.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em ptr} & Pointer to memory \\
\hline
{\em size} & Size of memory in bytes\\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
void 
\end{DoxyReturn}
\hypertarget{memutils_8h_a375b049125d95b43ad5e2c3544331f5e}{\index{memutils.\-h@{memutils.\-h}!Reverse\-Mem\-Cpy32@{Reverse\-Mem\-Cpy32}}
\index{Reverse\-Mem\-Cpy32@{Reverse\-Mem\-Cpy32}!memutils.h@{memutils.\-h}}
\subsubsection[{Reverse\-Mem\-Cpy32}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}void Reverse\-Mem\-Cpy32 (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{void $\ast$}]{dst, }
\item[{const void $\ast$}]{src, }
\item[{uint32\-\_\-t}]{size}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}\label{memutils_8h_a375b049125d95b43ad5e2c3544331f5e}


Copy memory from source to destination, reversing bytes. 

{\bfseries Description\-:} Copies {\ttfamily size} bytes from {\ttfamily src} memory area to {\ttfamily dst} memory area, reversing the bytes in the process so that the last byte in {\ttfamily dst} is the first byte in {\ttfamily src}. This is typically used to deal with endianness. Note that the buffers C\-A\-N\-N\-O\-T overlap. N\-O\-T\-E\-: Addresses and size must be 32-\/bit aligned.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em dst} & Pointer to destination memory area \\
\hline
{\em src} & Pointer to source memory area \\
\hline
{\em size} & Size of data in bytes\\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
void 
\end{DoxyReturn}
\hypertarget{memutils_8h_a7451a9119e26710c8ab9aaa2adc2ebad}{\index{memutils.\-h@{memutils.\-h}!Secure\-Mem\-Cmp32@{Secure\-Mem\-Cmp32}}
\index{Secure\-Mem\-Cmp32@{Secure\-Mem\-Cmp32}!memutils.h@{memutils.\-h}}
\subsubsection[{Secure\-Mem\-Cmp32}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}{\bf Mem\-Cmp\-\_\-\-Result\-\_\-t} Secure\-Mem\-Cmp32 (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{const void $\ast$}]{ptr1, }
\item[{const void $\ast$}]{ptr2, }
\item[{size\-\_\-t}]{n}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}\label{memutils_8h_a7451a9119e26710c8ab9aaa2adc2ebad}


Compares memory in a secure manner. 

{\bfseries Description\-:} Compares first {\ttfamily n} bytes of memory areas {\ttfamily ptr1} and {\ttfamily ptr2}. The comparison is done in secure way, where the execution time will always be the same (timing invariant), and a successful return value consists of more than a single bit being set. N\-O\-T\-E\-: Addresses and size must be 32-\/bit aligned.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em ptr1} & Pointer to memory area 1 \\
\hline
{\em ptr2} & Pointer to memory area 2 \\
\hline
{\em n} & Size in bytes of memory to compare\\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
{\ttfamily Mem\-Cmp\-\_\-\-Result\-\_\-t} indicating the result of the comparison. 
\end{DoxyReturn}
